channel.title: A simple Command
channel.description: How do I make a command that spawns items in your bank? Just curious I have no idea how and I need to know :P Btw using PI.

item.title: A simple Command
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

tyb97:

What do you mean? ^

The code you posted will only work with Java 7, as that’s when using Strings as case identifiers as added. ‘case “something”:’ Wont work in java 6

As for the exception, it’s very vague. Basically what you’re saying is
“If something goes wrong, or is not right, print “error” to the screen”.

Diagnosing the problem becomes very difficult at that point.

Read full topic

item.title: A simple Command
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

What do you mean? ^

Read full topic

item.title: A simple Command
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“DannyIsSoPro, post:6, topic:441233”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=543904.msg3989219#msg3989219 date=1336340212]

		case "item":
			try {
				int item = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
				int amount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
				c.getItems().addItem(item, amount);
			} catch (Exception e) {
				c.sendMessage("Error.");
			}
			break;

I use a case system for my commands, so you can figure out whats different there. But where it says,

c.getItems().addItem(item, amount);

There should be a method that places items in your bank, replace this with that method. I’m not sure what it is but you can figure it out…
[/quote]

Interesting way of using commands. GG ;)[/quote]

But it will only work with JDK7+, and the exception is very vague.

Read full topic

I use a case system for my commands, so you can figure out whats different there. But where it says,

c.getItems().addItem(item, amount);

There should be a method that places items in your bank, replace this with that method. I’m not sure what it is but you can figure it out…[/quote]

Interesting way of using commands. GG

item.title: A simple Command
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

		case "item":
			try {
				int item = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
				int amount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
				c.getItems().addItem(item, amount);
			} catch (Exception e) {
				c.sendMessage("Error.");
			}
			break;

I use a case system for my commands, so you can figure out whats different there. But where it says,

c.getItems().addItem(item, amount);

There should be a method that places items in your bank, replace this with that method. I’m not sure what it is but you can figure it out…

Read full topic
